author: Reuters Editorial
title: Euro edges up in choppy trade after Italian exit polls
text: March 4, 2018 / 10:26 PM / Updated 4 hours ago Euro edges up in choppy trade after Italian exit polls Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SYDNEY (Reuters) - The euro dipped then bounced in Asia early on Monday after an exit poll from the Italian election showed the result was likely to be a hung parliament but that the eurosceptic 5-Star Movement had not won enough seats to form government on its own. FILE PHOTO: Wads of euro banknotes are stacked in a pile at the Money Service Austria company's headquarters in Vienna, Austria, March 3, 2016. REUTERS/Leonhard Foeger The outcome was something of a relief and the single currency was trading up 0.27 percent at $1.2350 EUR= against a broadly soft dollar, following a brief dip to $0.2331. A centre-right coalition is set to win most seats in parliament ahead of 5-Star, with the centre-left third, according to the exit polls. The centre-right, made up of former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconiâ€™s Forza Italia (Go Italy!), and the far-right League and Brothers of Italy, are seen falling some way short of an absolute majority needed to govern, pollsters said. Reporting by Wayne Cole; Editing by Peter Cooney
